cells.text_content:
• Reported as not relevant by a large segment of the target population
• Generates an unacceptably large amount of missing data points
• Generates many questions or requests for clarification from patients as they
complete the PRO instrument
• Patients interpret items and responses in a way that is inconsistent with the
PRO instrument’s conceptual framework
cells.pdf_text_content: • Reported as not relevant by a large segment of the target population • Generates an unacceptably large amount of missing data points • Generates many questions or requests for clarification from patients as they complete the PRO instrument • Patients interpret items and responses in a way that is inconsistent with the PRO instrument’s conceptual framework

cells.text_content:
• A high percent of patients respond at the floor (response scale’s worst end)
or ceiling (response scale’s optimal end)
• Patients note that none of the response choices applies to them
• Distribution of item responses is highly skewed
cells.pdf_text_content: • A high percent of patients respond at the floor (response scale’s worst end) or ceiling (response scale’s optimal end) • Patients note that none of the response choices applies to them • Distribution of item responses is highly skewed

cells.text_content:
• All patients give the same answer (i.e., no variance)
• Most patients choose only one response choice
• Differences among patients are not detected when important differences are
known
cells.pdf_text_content: • All patients give the same answer (i.e., no variance) • Most patients choose only one response choice • Differences among patients are not detected when important differences are known

cells.text_content:
• Unstable scores over time when there is no logical reason for variation from
one assessment to the next
cells.pdf_text_content: • Unstable scores over time when there is no logical reason for variation from one assessment to the next

cells.text_content:
• Item highly correlated (redundant) withother items in the same concept of
interest
cells.pdf_text_content: • Item highly correlated (redundant) with other items in the same concept of interest

cells.text_content:
• Item is not sensitive (i.e., does not change when there is a known change in
the concepts of interest)
cells.pdf_text_content: • Item is not sensitive (i.e., does not change when there is a known change in the concepts of interest)

cells.text_content:
• Item is highly correlated with measures of concepts other than the one it is
intended to measure
• Item does not show variability in relation to some known population
characteristics (i.e., severity level, classification of condition, or other known
characteristic)
cells.pdf_text_content: • Item is highly correlated with measures of concepts other than the one it is intended to measure • Item does not show variability in relation to some known population characteristics (i.e., severity level, classification of condition, or other known characteristic)

cells.text_content:
• Item duplicates information collected with other items that have equal or
better measurement properties
cells.pdf_text_content: • Item duplicates information collected with other items that have equal or better measurement properties

cells.text_content:
• The population, disease state, or application of the instrument can affect the
appropriateness of the recall period
cells.pdf_text_content: • The population, disease state, or application of the instrument can affect the appropriateness of the recall period

cells.text_content:
Test-retest or intra-
interviewer reliability (for
interviewer-administered
PROs only)
cells.pdf_text_content: Test-retest or intra- interviewer reliability (for interviewer-administered PROs only)

cells.text_content:
Stability of scores over time when no change
is expected in the concept of interest
cells.pdf_text_content: Stability of scores over time when no change is expected in the concept of interest

cells.text_content:
• Intraclass correlation coefficient
• Time period of assessment
cells.pdf_text_content: • Intraclass correlation coefficient • Time period of assessment

cells.text_content:
• Extent to which items comprising a scale
measure the same concept
• Intercorrelation of items that contribute
to a score
• Internal consistency
cells.pdf_text_content: • Extent to which items comprising a scale measure the same concept • Intercorrelation of items that contribute to a score • Internal consistency

cells.text_content:
• Cronbach’s alpha for summary scores
• Item-total correlations
cells.pdf_text_content: • Cronbach’s alpha for summary scores • Item-total correlations

cells.text_content:
Agreement among responses when the PRO
is administered by two or more different
interviewers
cells.pdf_text_content: Agreement among responses when the PRO is administered by two or more different interviewers

cells.text_content:
Evidence that the instrument measures the
concept of interest including evidence from
qualitative studies that the items and domains
of an instrument are appropriate and
comprehensive relative to its intended
measurement concept, population, and use.
Testing other measurement properties will
not replace or rectify problems with content
validity.
cells.pdf_text_content: Evidence that the instrument measures the concept of interest including evidence from qualitative studies that the items and domains of an instrument are appropriate and comprehensive relative to its intended measurement concept, population, and use. Testing other measurement properties will not replace or rectify problems with content validity.

cells.text_content:
• Derivation of all items
• Qualitative interview schedule
• Interview or focus group transcripts
• Items derived from the transcripts
• Composition of patients used to develop content
• Cognitive interview transcripts to evaluate patient
understanding
cells.pdf_text_content: • Derivation of all items • Qualitative interview schedule • Interview or focus group transcripts • Items derived from the transcripts • Composition of patients used to develop content • Cognitive interview transcripts to evaluate patient understanding

cells.text_content:
Evidence that relationships among items,
domains, and concepts conform to a priori
hypotheses concerning logical relationships
that should exist with measures of related
concepts or scores produced in similar or
diverse patient groups
cells.pdf_text_content: Evidence that relationships among items, domains, and concepts conform to a priori hypotheses concerning logical relationships that should exist with measures of related concepts or scores produced in similar or diverse patient groups

cells.text_content:
• Strength of correlation testing a priori hypotheses
(discriminant and convergent validity)
• Degree to which the PRO instrument can distinguish
among groups hypothesized a priori to be different
(known groups validity)
cells.pdf_text_content: • Strength of correlation testing a priori hypotheses (discriminant and convergent validity) • Degree to which the PRO instrument can distinguish among groups hypothesized a priori to be different (known groups validity)

cells.text_content:
Evidence that a PRO instrument can identify
differences in scores over time in individuals
or groups (similar to those in the clinical
trials) who have changed with respect to the
measurement concept
cells.pdf_text_content: Evidence that a PRO instrument can identify differences in scores over time in individuals or groups (similar to those in the clinical trials) who have changed with respect to the measurement concept

cells.text_content:
• Within person change over time
• Effect size statistic
cells.pdf_text_content: • Within person change over time • Effect size statistic
